snippet: A protest march across the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge is planned, though no one seems quite sure who is running either the demonstration or the bridge.
abstract: New York City officials appear to be distancing themselves from oversight authority over march across Verrazano-Narrows Bridge planned by Rev Al Sharpton as protest of the role police played in death of Staten Island man Eric Garner; there also appears to be confusion among organizers about who will be in charge of the event.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and NIKITA STEWART
byline.contributor: J. David Goodman and Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A protest march across the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge is planned, though no one seems quite sure who is running either the demonstration or the bridge.

headline.main: With March in Chokehold Case, Questions Over Who’s in Charge
headline.print_headline: Confusion Over March in Chokehold Case
